definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: Procuratorial authority has the administrative power and double judicial powers attribute.
sentences.chinese: 檢察權具有行政權和司法權的雙重屬性。

sentences.english: In India"s parliamentary system, the executive is subordinate to the legislature.
sentences.chinese: 在印度的議會制度中，立法權高於行政權。

sentences.english: Executive authority is vested in a Governor, popularly elected for a four-year term.
sentences.chinese: 行政權被授予了一位被選舉的行政長官，任期爲四年。

sentences.english: Cambodia is now a constitutional monarchy where executive power is held by the prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 柬埔寨現在是一個君主立憲制國家，首相行使行政權。

sentences.english: Only a person with administrative rights can backdate a Transaction.
sentences.chinese: 只有具有行政權的人才可以將交易倒填日期。

sentences.english: Then plotting the purview of the power of Fabu and Daliyuan, separate the judicial administrative authority with the judiciary power.
sentences.chinese: 第二步是明確部院權限，將司法行政權與審判權分開。

definition: the right to be elected/the right to stand for election
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
